intro: Scirpus dregeanus, commonly known as the tall bulrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and rushes. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height, often growing in wetlands and along water bodies. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its inflorescence consists of spikes of small, three-ranked flowers. Scirpus dregeanus plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
